title: The Flight of Queen Mathilde from Oxford
provenance_text:
Thomas Lowinsky [1892-1947], London, England until November 1936 [1]; Charles J. Rosenbloom [1898-1973], Pittsburgh, PA (Lugt Suppl. 633b), November 1936 until April 1, 1973 [2]; bequest to Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, February 1974.

Notes:
[1]. The painting was exhibited in "The "1936 International Exhibition of Paintings" at Carnegie Institute, October-December 1936 (no. 108.)
[2]. Mr. Rosenbloom purchased the painting from the 1936 International for Â£105 ($525). See copies of relevant digitized documents from Archives of American Art in curatorial file.
